sep.seeter.net.channel

Class ClientChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.seeter.net.channel.ClientChannel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class ClientChannel
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A client-side channel for interacting with an instance of sep.seeter.server.Server.

    Usage protocol:

    • Create a new instance of ClientChannel supplying the host name and port number of the server.
    • Use send and receive to exchange instances of Message with the server. These calls may be performed in any sequence (note: ClientChannel is not thread-safe) that respects the message protocol (see the documentation for each message), and any number of times (possibly zero), up to the occurrence of any error (e.g., IOException).
    • Use close to close the communication session.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClientChannel(java.lang.String host, int port)
      Allocate a new client channel object for communicating with an instance of sep.seeter.server.Server listening at the specified host and port.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Close the encapsulated socket and I/O streams, if any currently open.
      boolean isOpen()
      Returns true if, and only if, this channel is open, meaning that it currently encapsulates a TCP socket.
      Message receive()
      Receive a message from the server specified at channel creation.
      void send(Message msg)
      Send a message to the server specified at channel creation.

        public ClientChannel(java.lang.String host,
                     int port)
        Allocate a new client channel object for communicating with an instance of sep.seeter.server.Server listening at the specified host and port.
        Parameters:

        public boolean isOpen()
        Returns true if, and only if, this channel is open, meaning that it currently encapsulates a TCP socket.
        Returns:

        public void send(Message msg)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Send a message to the server specified at channel creation.
        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • receive

        public Message receive()
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Receive a message from the server specified at channel creation. This method blocks (i.e., does not return) until a message is received, or an error occurs.
        Returns:
        The received message, if successful
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Class of serialized object cannot be found

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Close the encapsulated socket and I/O streams, if any currently open.

        Guaranteed post condition: !isOpen(). This operation is idempotent provided the other methods are not called.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs
